plot: Imitating, Fast and Slow: Robust learning from demonstrations via decision-time planning
summary: Imitation with Planning at Test-time (IMPLANT) is a new meta-algorithm for imitation learning that utilizes decision-time planning to correct for compounding errors of any base imitation policy. IMPLANT significantly outperforms benchmark imitation learning approaches on standard control environments and excels at zero-shot generalization when subject to challenging perturbations in test-time dynamics. Empirically, they demonstrate that IMPLAN significantly outperform benchmark imitation. learning approaches to generalization outperforms benchmarks.
